octeon_mem_map.h

00039 #include "octeon-boot-info.h"
00040 
00041 /** Debugger related defines */
00042 #define DEBUG_STACK_SIZE        1024    /* Size of the debugger stack */
00043 
00044 /** Total number of (64 bit)registers stored. Must match debug_handler.S */
00045 #define DEBUG_NUMREGS           512
00046 
00047 #ifndef EXCEPTION_BASE_BASE
00048 #define EXCEPTION_BASE_BASE     0   /* must be 4k aligned */
00049 #endif
00050 /** Increment size for exception base addresses (4k minimum) */
00051 #ifndef EXCEPTION_BASE_INCR
00052 #define EXCEPTION_BASE_INCR     (4*1024)
00053 #endif
00054 /* 16 4k blocks */
00055 
00056 /* Each SE app has its own execption vectors and they start at this base
00057 address.
00058   - The size for each application is 4K
00059   - Assuming a max of 31 SE apps the exception vectors could range from
00060     the base to base + 124K
00061 */
00062 #define SE_APP_EXCEPTION_BASE 0x2000
00063 /* We do not really need 16K for exception vectors - 4K are enough
00064  * This will allow to have bigger number of hotplug_app running
00065  * at the same time and described in hotplug_named block structure.
00066  * For CN78xx, up to 48 cores can run up to 48 different hotplug_apps.
00067  * If you see a issue do '#define SE_APP_EXCEPTION_SIZE 0x1000'.
00068  * I am not changing it now for backword compatibility reason.
00069  */
00070 #define SE_APP_EXCEPTION_SIZE 0x4000
00071 
00072 #define BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_REG_SAVE_SIZE  (CVMX_MAX_CORES * DEBUG_NUMREGS * 8)
00073 #define BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_STACK_SIZE  (CVMX_MAX_CORES * DEBUG_STACK_SIZE)
00074 #define BOOTLOADER_PCI_READ_BUFFER_SIZE     (256)
00075 #define BOOTLOADER_PCI_WRITE_BUFFER_SIZE     (256)
00076 
00077 /** Bootloader debugger stub register save area follows exception vector space */
00078 #define BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_REG_SAVE_BASE  \
00079     (EXCEPTION_BASE_BASE + OCTEON_EXCEPTION_VECTOR_BLOCK_SIZE)
00080 /** debugger stack follows reg save area */
00081 #define BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_STACK_BASE \
00082     (BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_REG_SAVE_BASE + BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_REG_SAVE_SIZE)
00083 /* pci communication blocks.  Read/write are from bootloader perspective*/
00084 /** Original bootloader command block */
00085 #define BOOTLOADER_PCI_READ_BUFFER_BASE \
00086     (BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_STACK_BASE + BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_STACK_SIZE)
00087 
00088 #define BOOTLOADER_BOOTMEM_DESC_ADDR    \
00089     (BOOTLOADER_PCI_READ_BUFFER_BASE + BOOTLOADER_PCI_READ_BUFFER_SIZE)
00090 
00091 /** BOOTLOADER_BOOTMEM_DESC_ADDR size */
00092 #define BOOTLOADER_BOOTMEM_DESC_SPACE   \
00093     (BOOTLOADER_BOOTMEM_DESC_ADDR + 0x8)
00094 
00095 #define BOOTLOADER_END_RESERVED_SPACE   \
00096     (BOOTLOADER_BOOTMEM_DESC_SPACE + 128 /* space for actual descriptor */)
00097 /* NOTE: The bootmem descriptor (allocated at BOOTLOADER_BOOTMEM_DESC_SPACE can
00098  * be moved without affecting users, as the address is looked upt from
00099  * BOOTLOADER_BOOTMEM_DESC_ADDR.  It is the BOOTLOADER_BOOTMEM_DESC_ADDR field
00100  * that can't be easily changed.
00101  */
00102 
00103 /* Use the range EXCEPTION_BASE_BASE + 0x800 - 0x1000 (2k-4k) for bootloader
00104  * private data structures that need fixed addresses
00105  */
00106 /* NOTE changes to these macros have to be changed in
00107  * executive/octeon-boot-info.h also.
00108  */
00109 
00110 #ifndef BOOTLOADER_PRIV_DATA_BASE
00111 # define BOOTLOADER_PRIV_DATA_BASE        (EXCEPTION_BASE_BASE + 0x800)
00112 #endif
00113 
00114 #ifndef BOOTLOADER_BOOT_VECTOR
00115 # define BOOTLOADER_BOOT_VECTOR           (BOOTLOADER_PRIV_DATA_BASE)
00116 #endif
00117 
00118 #ifndef BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_TRAMPOLINE
00119 /* WORD */
00120 # define BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_TRAMPOLINE        \
00121     (BOOTLOADER_BOOT_VECTOR + BOOT_VECTOR_SIZE)
00122 #endif
00123 
00124 #ifndef BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_TRAMPOLINE_CORE
00125 /* WORD * NUM_CORES */
00126 # define BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_TRAMPOLINE_CORE   \
00127     (BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_TRAMPOLINE + 4)
00128 #endif
00129 
00130 #ifndef BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_FLAGS_BASE
00131 /* WORD * NUM_CORES */
00132 # define BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_FLAGS_BASE        \
00133     (BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_TRAMPOLINE_CORE + 4*CVMX_MAX_CORES)
00134 #endif
00135 
00136 #ifndef BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_CORE_ALIGN_PAD
00137 /* WORD */
00138 #define BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_CORE_ALIGN_PAD \
00139     (BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_FLAGS_BASE + 12)
00140 #endif
00141 
00142 #ifndef BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_CORE_RESET_COUNT
00143 /* WORD */
00144 #define BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_CORE_RESET_COUNT   \
00145     (BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_CORE_ALIGN_PAD + 0)
00146 #endif
00147 
00148 #ifndef BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_CORE_REVID_COUNT
00149 /* WORD */
00150 #define BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_CORE_REVID_COUNT   \
00151     (BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_CORE_RESET_COUNT + 4)
00152 #endif
00153 
00154 #ifndef BOOTLOADER_NEXT_AVAIL_ADDR
00155 /* WORD */
00156 #define BOOTLOADER_NEXT_AVAIL_ADDR      \
00157     (BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_CORE_REVID_COUNT + 4)
00158 #endif
00159 
00160 /* Debug flag bit definitions in cvmx-bootloader.h */
00161 
00162 /* Address used for boot vectors for non-zero cores */
00163 #ifndef BOOT_VECTOR_BASE
00164 #define BOOT_VECTOR_BASE    (0x80000000 | BOOTLOADER_BOOT_VECTOR)
00165 #endif
00166 
00167 /* Defines for creating named block for idle cores to loop. */
00168 #define IDLE_CORE_BLOCK_NAME    "idle-core-loop"
00169 #define IDLE_CORE_BLOCK_SIZE    0x10
00170 
00171 /* Reserved DRAM for exception vectors, bootinfo structures, bootloader, etc */
00172 //#define OCTEON_RESERVED_LOW_MEM_SIZE    (1*1024*1024 - IDLE_CORE_BLOCK_SIZE)
00173 
00174 /* Reserved DRAM for flat device tree */
00175 #define OCTEON_FDT_BASE     (512 * 1024)
00176 #define OCTEON_FDT_MAX_SIZE (128 * 1024)
00177 
00178 /** Alignment for U-Boot exception handler table */
00179 #define OCTEON_UBOOT_EXCEPT_HANDLER_ALIGNMENT   (4096)
00180 /** Reserved for U-Boot exception handler */
00181 #define OCTEON_UBOOT_EXCEPT_HANDLER_BASE    \
00182     ((OCTEON_FDT_BASE + OCTEON_FDT_MAX_SIZE +       \
00183       OCTEON_UBOOT_EXCEPT_HANDLER_ALIGNMENT - 1) &      \
00184      ~(OCTEON_UBOOT_EXCEPT_HANDLER_ALIGNMENT - 1))
00185 /** Size of exception handler table */
00186 #define OCTEON_UBOOT_EXCEPT_HANDLER_SIZE    (0x500)
00187 
00188 /** Reserved DRAM for exception vectors, bootinfo structures, bootloader, etc */
00189 /* Only 512MB of RAM is reserved initially so that other structures can use
00190  * named blocks within the first 1MB.  The bootloader is responsible for
00191  * reserving all memory in the first 1MB
00192  */
00193 #define OCTEON_RESERVED_LOW_MEM_SIZE    (512*1024)
00194 
00195 /** NOTE: U-Boot will always reserve the first 1MB of memory */
00196 #define OCTEON_RESERVED_LOW_BOOT_MEM_SIZE       (1024*1024)
00197 
00198 /** Reserved DRAM for idle code */
00199 #define OCTEON_IDLE_CORE_MEM    (1*1024*1024 - IDLE_CORE_BLOCK_SIZE)
00200 #define OCTEON_LINUX_RESERVED_MEM  (OCTEON_IDLE_CORE_MEM + IDLE_CORE_BLOCK_SIZE)
00201 
00202 #define OCTEON_BOOTLOADER_NAMED_BLOCK_TMP_PREFIX "__tmp"
00203 
00204 /* The environment variables used for controlling the reserved block allocations
00205  * are:
00206  *
00207  * octeon_reserved_mem_bl_base
00208  * octeon_reserved_mem_bl_size
00209  * octeon_reserved_mem_linux_base
00210  * octeon_reserved_mem_linux_size
00211  *
00212  * If the size is defined to be 0, then the reserved block is not created.  See
00213  * bootloader HTML documentation for more information.
00214  */
00215 
00216 /**
00217  * DRAM reserved for loading images.  This is freed just
00218  * before the application starts, but is used by the bootloader for
00219  * loading ELF images, etc */
00220 #define OCTEON_BOOTLOADER_LOAD_MEM_NAME    "__tmp_load"
00221 
00222 /**
00223  * DRAM section reserved for the Linux kernel (we want this to be contiguous
00224  * with the bootloader reserved area to that they can be merged on free.
00225  */
00226 #define OCTEON_LINUX_RESERVED_MEM_NAME    "__tmp_reserved_linux"
00227 
00228 /**
00229  * Named block name for block containing u-boot environment that is created
00230  * for use by application
00231  */
00232 #define OCTEON_ENV_MEM_NAME    "__bootloader_env"
00233 
00234 /**
00235  * Named block name for block containing the flat device tree that is created
00236  * for use by applications and the Linux kernel.
00237  */
00238 #define OCTEON_FDT_BLOCK_NAME   "__fdt"
00239 
00240 /** Named block for U-Boot exception handler */
00241 #define OCTEON_UBOOT_EXCEPT_HANDLER_NAME    "__tmp_uboot_exception"
